question: Method overloading in Python is not directly supported, but you can achieve similar behavior using ________ arguments or *args.
Method overloading involves creating multiple methods with the same name but different ________ or types of parameters.
In Python, method overloading is typically achieved by using ________ to make some parameters optional.
The *args syntax in Python allows a method to accept a ________ number of arguments.
Method overriding in Python allows a child class to redefine a method from its ________ class.
In method overriding, the method name in the child class must be the same as in the ________ class.
The super() function in Python is used to call a method from the ________ class within a child class.
Method overloading and method overriding are both used in ________ programming.
Method overloading is not directly supported in Python because it is a ________ typed language.
To simulate method overloading in Python, you can use ________ arguments or conditional logic within a single method.
